results.title: Kundun
results.creator_credit: Martin Scorsese, Barbara de Fina, Refuge Productions, Cappa Productions and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Scorsese’s drama detailing the Dalai Lama’s life story was in development for seven years, with the Dalai Lama having input into the 14 screenplay drafts. With four actors portraying the Dalai Lama at different ages, the film begins in 1933 with the death of the 13th Dalai Lama. Born in a remote area, the new Dalai Lama (seen at ages two and five in early sequences) is observed by monks who determine that he is the 14th reincarnation of the Buddha of Compassion. In 1944 he uses newsreels and Western magazines to study WWII events, and as the war ends, he is forced to deal with Chinese Communist aggression. Mao’s military stranglehold on Tibet eventually forces the Dalai Lama to flee to Dharmsala, India. Commenting on the anti-spiritual…Marxist government of the Chinese Communists, Scorsese remarked, “What interests me is how a man of non-violence deals with these people — that’s ultimately the story.” With a $28 million budget, he re-created Tibet’s tragedy by filming in south-central Morocco with a cast of nonprofessional Tibetan actors. Second unit work took place at locations in Idaho and British Columbia. Cast includes Tenzin Thuthob Tsarong, Gyurme Ththong, Tencho Gyalpo, Tsewang Migyur Khangsar and Sonam Phunstok.

results.title: Lift to the scaffold = L'Ascenseur pour l'echafaud
results.creator_credit: Louis Malle, Jean Thuillier and Nouvelles Éditions de Films
results.brief_description: This taut, tense and incredibly fast paced thriller features Jeanne Moreau and Maurice Ronet as passionate lovers who embark on a plan to murder her husband. However, the plan goes terribly wrong when the murderer finds himself trapped in a faulty lift. While his lover searches frantically through Paris for him, he grows increasingly more desperate, and she finds herself trapped in another’s scheming plans. Based on a novel by Noel Calef, Louis Malle directs with an audacious vitality, while Moreau and Ronet are wonderful as the callous lovers. The film’s musical score is by jazz legend Miles Davis. The film won the prestigious Prix Delluc, one of French cinema’s most important awards. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Children of the marshland = Les Enfants du marais [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Jean Becker, Herve Truffaut, Fechner Productions and UGC Images
results.brief_description: Following his demobilization at the end of WWI, Garris (Jacques Gamblin) wanders around country France, until the day he meets an old man (Jacques Dufilho) living in a marshland and lets himself be talked into dropping his swag and tasting life as a free man. Very soon Garris becomes de facto mentor to his immediate neighbours, Riton (Jacques Villeret), a devoted father with a penchant for the bottle, his wife and three children. The rest of the story is told by Cri-Cri, the youngest of Riton’s children, and through the audience is introduced to the many characters and threads of life that constitute the town bordering on the marshlands: Amedee, the jazz-loving dandy, Jo Sardi, boxer with a rather nasty streak, Marie, the maid who captures Garris’ heart, and above all Mister Richard (a.k.a Pepe la Grenouille), a former marshland resident turned industrialist who yearns to return where his heart truly belongs. This is a work of openly declared nostalgia for irretrievably vanished days. Veteran filmmaker Jean Becker declared that this adaptation from a novel by Georges Montforez was not targeted at an elderly audience, rather he made this film for his grandchildren, to show them a world before Internet and Nintendo. Presented in letterbox version to retain the original widescreen format. Cast also includes Michel Serrault, Andre Dussolier, Eric Cantona and Suzanne Flon. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Sure thing
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Roger Birnbaum and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Walt Gibson, “Gib”, is a college freshman from the East Coast obsessed with “scoring”. After striking out with fellow student, Alison - the control freak, he decides to head west to California after his best friend assures him of a “sure thing”. What Gib doesn’t know is that Alison is also planning a trip to California to visit her stuffy fiancee. They end up sharing the same ride and misadventures, which ultimately draws them together. Cast includes: John Cusack, Daphne Zuniga, Boyd Gaines, Tim Robbins, Lisa Persky and Anthony Edwards.

results.title: Notting Hill
results.creator_credit: Roger Mitchell, Duncan Kenworthy and PolyGram Filmed Entertainment
results.brief_description: Hugh Grant plays William Thacker, owner of a travel bookstore in London’s Notting Hill. A chance visit to his store by famous American movie star, Anna Scott, played by Julia Roberts, sparks a complicated romance between the two. The worlds of celebrity and everyday people in collision creates a series of misunderstandings and dilemmas which divide and reunite the pair on more than one occasion. In an adventurous finale William rallies his ensemble of old friends and a mad flatmate to try one last time to get the girl. A British romantic comedy from the makers of “Four Weddings and a Funeral”. Cast also includes Hugh Bonneville, Emma Chambers and James Dreyfus.

results.title: Rebecca
results.creator_credit: Jim O'Brien, Hilary Heath and Carlton U K Television
results.brief_description: Daphne du Maurier’s classic story of love, jealousy and secrets is revamped here with a British cast that includes Charles Dance, Faye Dunaway and Diana Rigg. Emilia Fox plays the modest and shy young woman, who meets, falls in love with, and eventually marries Maxim de Winter, a widower on vacation. When the new Mrs de Winter arrives at Maxim’s mansion, Manderley, she finds a house of hostile servants, most notably the housekeeper who works with sinister cunning to keep alive the influence of her late mistress, Rebecca.

results.title: Joseph and the amazing technicolor dreamcoat
results.creator_credit: David Mallet, Steven Pimlott, Andrew Lloyd Webber and Really Useful Films
results.brief_description: The first musical blockbuster by the immensely successful Rice and Weber song writing duo, this straight-to-video recording of the spectacular stage production features Donny Osmond as Joseph. Based on the Biblical story of Joseph and his coat of many colors. Joseph is the favorite son of Jacob (Richard Attenborough), but his eleven brothers resent the attention their father showers upon him and sell him into slavery. Eventually, the favored son finds himself in jail, however his favorable interpretation of the dreams of the Pharaoh win him the admiration of the all-powerful leader, and soon Joseph is one of the most powerful men in Egypt. Songs include ‘Close Every Door to Me, ‘Go Go Go Joseph’ and ‘Any Dream Will Do’. Cast also includes Joan Collins and David Grindrod.

results.title: Tosca: A Tale of love and torture
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Patricia Lovell, Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description: It is 1999 and Opera Australia need a hit at the box office. They decide to stage Puccini’s masterwork- about a passionate young diva caught in the political turmoil of 19th century Rome- as a lavish production to lure the patrons. However, with a tight budget rehearsal time is cut to the bone and cast and crew are given just three weeks to prepare before the curtain is raised. Backstage drama and tensions build as opening night draws rapidly closer, Director Trevor Graham (who also directed ‘Mabo: Life of an island man’) was granted unrestricted access to film behind the scenes, from day one of rehearsals to opening night at the Sydney Opera House. This production stars Joan Carden as Floria Tosca and is conducted by Roderick Brydon.

results.title: What becomes of the broken hearted?
results.creator_credit: Ian Mune, Bill Gavin and Sequel Productions
results.brief_description: It’s five years from where “Once were warriors” left us, and Jake the Muss has turned his back on his family - breaking old habits is not as easy. His long suffering wife, Beth (Rena Owen), has left him and is living with someone new. Jake too has started a new relationship which is punctuated by violence and alcohol abuse. He is reunited with Beth and younger son, Sonny (Clint Eruera), at the funeral of Nig, who died in a gang fight. Tensions flare between Jake and Sonny, and as Sonny delves deeper into the dangerous world of gangs to gain retribution for his elder brother’s death, Jake must face, once and for all, the demons of the past and open up to the possibility of change, and survival.

results.title: Two hands
results.creator_credit: Gregor Jordan, Marian MacGowan, Meridian Films and CML
results.brief_description: Set in Sydney’s King’s Cross, 19 year old Jimmy (Heath Ledger) finds himself in debt to a local gangster, Pando, played by perennial Australian actor Bryan Brown, when a simple job goes wrong. Jimmy’s life depends on his locating the $10,000 he has lost. As his scheme to replace the cash is played out, two street kids are enjoying a shopping spree with the original loot. The black humour of the film progressively darkens as the story unfolds. Rose Byrne co-stars as country girl, Alex, who becomes involved with Jimmy and his increasingly dire situation.
